bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. KIRKPATRICK:H.R. 3704.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, section 3 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates grants Congress the authority to enact this bill.[Page H7688]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

item.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

summary.text:
Sedona-Red Rock National Scenic Area Act of 2010 [sic] - Establishes the Sedona-Red Rock National Scenic Area in the Coconino National Forest in Arizona to limit exchanges of land involving National Forest System land included in the Scenic Area and to manage the System land included in the Scenic Area as provided in the land resource management plan for the Forest.

Bars the inclusion of any land located outside the boundaries of Coconino National Forest in the Scenic Area.

bill.title: Sedona-Red Rock National Scenic Area Act of 2010

item.title: Sedona-Red Rock National Scenic Area Act of 2010
To establish the Sedona-Red Rock National Scenic Area in the Coconino National Forest, Arizona, and for other purposes.
Sedona-Red Rock National Scenic Area Act of 2010

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
